commentary.revenue_performance: Q4 turnover was ₹4,376 crores (9% growth 12-month basis); full year revenue was ₹17,535 crores (6% growth 12-month basis)[cite: 2221, 2225, 2290]. Management noted clear signs of recovery of the slowdown in the FMCG industry[cite: 2219].
commentary.profitability: Full year cost efficiency savings reached **9x** the 2013-14 base, achieving almost **2.5% of overall revenue**[cite: 2261, 2262]. Operating profit for the quarter was 16.6%[cite: 2303]. Aggressive inflation was seen in Palm oil (54% YoY) and Cocoa (83% YoY), necessitating price action[cite: 2276, 2277, 2280].
commentary.business_outlook: Management is **reasonably optimistic** on recovery trends continuing into the next year (FY26)[cite: 2319, 2320]. The focus remains on sustaining margins while remaining competitive[cite: 2289]. The endeavor is to get back to **double-digit growth** with time[cite: 2396, 2397].
commentary.key_challenges: The quarter saw aggressive inflation, especially in **Palm oil (54% YoY)** and **Cocoa (83% YoY)**, despite forward buying[cite: 2276, 2277]. Salary costs were lower in Q4 due to phantom stock revaluation write-backs.
commentary.strategic_initiatives: Direct reach expanded to $28.7 	ext{ lakh}$ outlets and rural distributors to $31,000$[cite: 2228, 2229]. The **Route to Market (RTM) 2.0** pilot is planned for H2 FY25. Croissant achieved **high double-digit growth (3x biscuits)**[cite: 2249].
commentary.market_conditions: Real and Nominal Private Final Consumption Expenditure showed signs of trending upwards in Q3 and Q4, suggesting a recovery from the slowdown[cite: 2218, 2219].
